target.name: BridgeHead
target.text: For a quick installation edit the following sections:

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Change the Host name in the Network section. Change the port number to 80 and the securePort to 443 if this is a dedicated server.

target.name: Step
target.text: Change the Host name in the Network section. Change the port number to 80 and the securePort to 443 if this is a dedicated server.

target.name: Step
target.text: Consider changing the JavaVirtualMachine setting in the Memory section if you have a large installation.

target.name: Step
target.text: Use the default file system configuration. This stores the files in /home/icecoredata

target.name: Step
target.text: The default database configuration is MySQL, with the default MySQL passwords.

target.name: Step
target.text: Use the default Lucene configuration (unless you are installing a standalone Lucene Index Server.

target.name: Step
target.text: Modify the Email section with your SMTP and POP/IMAP servers.

target.name: Step
target.text: If you are using ICEcore Conference, change the settings in the Presence configuration.

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Using the Liferay Enterprise Admin portlet, click on the Users tab.

target.name: Step
target.text: Using the Liferay Enterprise Admin portlet, click on the Users tab.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Add.

target.name: Step
target.text: Fill in the following fields: First, Last Name, assign a User ID, specify the e-mail address, and then click Save.

target.name: Step
target.text: Liferay shows an extended form.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Save.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click on the Password tab, type in the password, and then click Save.

target.name: Step
target.text: Repeat these steps to add additional users.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: User Management with LDAP/eDirectory

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Using the Liferay Enterprise Admin portlet, click on the Settings tab (you may need to click on the >> tab to see the Settings tab).

target.name: Step
target.text: Using the Liferay Enterprise Admin portlet, click on the Settings tab (you may need to click on the >> tab to see the Settings tab).

target.name: Step
target.text: Click on the Authentication tab.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click on the LDAP tab.

target.name: Step
target.text: Fill out the form with the values needed to map to your corporate directory:

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: For the search filter use uid=@screen_name@ or cn=@screen_name@, depending on your site conventions.

target.name: Step
target.text: For the search filter use uid=@screen_name@ or cn=@screen_name@, depending on your site conventions.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under If the user... add: password=givenName or password=sn.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Export Settings, we recommend deselecting the Export Enabled option.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Save.
